title: Ticket #7542: SLOT_TYPE_N configuration works START, not for RANK, etc
description:
CHTC tried to use a SLOT_TYPE_<n>_RANK to have different rank expressions for different slot types, but all slots ended up with either the default rank expression or 0. This is because there is a bug in the code that loads SLOT_TYPE_<N> overrides for any of the standard policy knobs - the code repeatedly loads START, while looping through a table of knob names.

here is the list: 

    SUSPEND, CONTINUE, PREEMPT, KILL,
    SUSPEND_VANILLA, CONTINUE_VANILLA, PREEMPT_VANILLA, KILL_VANILLA,
    WANT_SUSPEND, WANT_VACATE,
    WANT_HOLD, WANT_HOLD_REASON, WANT_HOLD_SUBCODE,
    WANT_SUSPEND_VANILLA, WANT_VACATE_VANILLA,
    CLAIM_WORKLIFE, MaxJobRetirementTime, MachineMaxVacateTime,
    PERIODIC_CHECKPOINT, RunBenchmarks, Rank,
    START_BACKFILL, EVICT_BACKFILL, FetchWorkDelay,
    HIBERNATE, Unhibernate,
    SlotWeight, IsOwner, CpuBusy,
remarks:
